newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks end sharply down on labour talks.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks end sharply down on labour talks.

text.p: South Korean stocks closed sharply lower on Tuesday after investors became skeptical about an early end to the current labour dispute despite President Kim Young-sam's talks with opposition leaders, brokers said.
Views the market was overbought also sparked institutional selling, they added.
The composite stock index shed 27.92 points, or 3.89 percent, to provisionally close at 690.54.
